meanings.definition: A small handheld tool with a flat, pointed blade used for spreading and smoothing mortar or plaster.
meanings.sent1: The mason used a trowel to fix the bricks in place.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps her trowels clean and organized in the toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The trowel felt proud to help build a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent4: The trowel danced gracefully over the wet cement, creating a smooth finish.
meanings.sent5: The shiny trowel gleamed in the sunlight as it worked on the construction site.

meanings.definition: To use a trowel to apply or spread material.
meanings.sent1: He carefully trowels the adhesive onto the tiles before placing them on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The gardener trowels the soil to prepare it for planting flowers.
meanings.sent3: She trowels on the paint with precision, making sure every corner is covered.
meanings.sent4: The artist trowels the clay into intricate shapes, creating beautiful sculptures.
meanings.sent5: The chef trowels the frosting onto the cake, adding the final touch to the dessert.

meanings.definition: A person who uses a trowel for construction or gardening tasks.
meanings.sent1: The skilled trowel quickly finished the brick wall with expertise.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the best trowel in the construction team.
meanings.sent3: The friendly trowel always has a smile while working in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The dedicated trowel is always ready to lend a hand in any building project.
meanings.sent5: The experienced trowel teaches newcomers how to use the tool effectively.
